metadata.title: CVE-2022-48626 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: moxart:fix potential use-after-free on remove path It was reported that the mmchost structure could be accessed after it was freed in moxart_remove(), sofix this by saving the base register of the device and using it instead ofthe pointer dereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48626` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-lowlatency - 4.4.0-239.273
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-177-generic - 4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-177-generic - 4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-177-lowlatency - 4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1118-kvm - 4.4.0-1118.128
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1155-aws - 4.4.0-1155.170
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1128-aws - 4.15.0-1128.137~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1138-azure - 4.15.0-1138.151~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1122-gcp - 4.15.0-1122.136~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1093-oracle - 4.15.0-1093.102~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-239.273').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-177.186~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1118.128').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1155.170').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1128.137~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1138.151~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.4.0-1088.95').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1122.136~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.102~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
